content.raw:
> So physics has to be moved out of necessity

Agreed. I'd just point out that the "system" will not be moved. I'd expect that normally there will always be a physics system in all runners. What's being moved are actually entities and their components, and this will affect the system's internal state.

> Added complexity for system authors as they have to make sure all their state is kept in the ECS.

+1
> Risk of instability when transport nodes get destroyed and recreated

+1

---

It all boils down to systems keeping internal state. Ideally, systems shouldn't have an internal state at all. They should just be functions which act on entities and components. I remember a comment from @mxgrey in some PR that ign-physics itself uses an ECS pattern internally. So I wonder if there's a recommended way of integrating ign-physics into ign-gazebo while minimizing the costs of moving state mentioned above.
